data.title: Anoop Seelin
data.meta_description: Anoop Seelin - News - IMDb - Movies, TV, Celebs, and more...
data.text:
ReviewThe Kannada remake of the 2018 Telugu film ‘C/o Kancharapalem’, ‘Monsoon Raaga’ is directed by S Ravindranath.Shivani KavaThe 2018 Telugu film C/o Kancharapalem is one of the best slice-of-life films to have emerged recently. Remakes are desirable, given that the film is socially relevant and rejects toxic masculinity through the insightful, sensitive portrayal of its male leads. The Kannada remake, Monsoon Raaga, directed by S Ravindranath brings to life four tales of romance, amid evolving attitudes on relationships, gender and religion. Forty-nine-year-old Raju (Achyuth Kumar), a single man, cannot claim to be content with his marital status. Things seem to never work out for him and he often faces pressure from his peers to get married. He slowly, reluctantly falls in love with his 42-year-old work supervisor Haasini (Suhasini Maniratnam), who asks him to marry her. Schoolboy Sundara wears a pink shirt to school to impress his crush, Suchitra, but ends...

SandalwoodWith the film industry getting back on its feet after the pandemic, here’s a tentative list of Sandalwood films release dates. Digital NativeThe film industry is slowly but steadily getting back on its feet with theatres reopening after the Covid–19 lockdown since March last year. In fact, there is a long line of films in Sandalwood waiting for the release. Here’s a tentative list with the release dates. Ramarjuna (January 29) - Ramarjuna is an upcoming Kannada film that is directed by Anish Tejaswar. Anish is also playing the lead role in it. Interestingly, the Kannada Power Star Puneeth Rajkumar has rendered a song in this flick which has been composed by Vidya Sagar. Inspector Vikram (February 5) - Prajwal Devaraj and Bhavana play the lead pair in Inspector Vikram which has Ramesh Aravind as the villain. Darshan will be seen making a cameo appearance in this flick. The technical...

EntertainmentBhavana first met Naveen while working in the Kannada film ‘Romeo’.Digital NativeActor Bhavana and producer Naveen celebrated their third wedding anniversary on January 22. Posting a picture, Bhavana wrote on her Instagram page, “I chose you. And I’ll choose you over and over and over, without a pause, without a doubt in a Heartbeat. And I’ll keep choosing you. Happy 3rd Anniversary My Love #LoveOfMyLife #MineForever.” Bhavana first met Naveen while working in the Kannada film Romeo, which he produced in 2012. They got married on January 22, 2018. Fans, well-wishers, and friends have been pouring in their wishes to the couple on social media. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Mrs June6 ‍♀️ (@bhavzmenon) On the work front, Bhavana is busy with several Kannada films. She is sharing screen space with Shiva Rajkumar in Bhajarangi 2. Directed by A Harsha, the technical crew of Bhajarangi 2 comprises Arjun Janya for music composition,...

SandalwoodWhile Anjali has been roped in to star opposite Shiva Rajkumar, the star cast also includes Dhananjaya and Pruthvi Ambaar.Digital NativeFile PhotoReports surfaced a few months ago that cinematographer-turned-director Vijay Milton will be wielding the megaphone for a movie, which will have the Kannada superstar Shiva Rajkumar playing the lead role. Incidentally, this will be Vijay Milton’s debut Kannada directorial. The latest update is that the film was flagged off on Thursday, with the official pooja at the Dodda Ganapati temple in Bengaluru, in the presence of all the team members. Shiva Rajkumar had tweeted a photo and captioned it, “Back to work for my new film.” Anjali will star opposite Shiva Rajkumar in the film. The shooting will begin on November 23, with Shivanna and Pruthvi Ambaar joining the sets at Sanskrit College in Bengaluru. It will be a 40-day-long schedule, with Dhananjaya, who will reportedly play an important role in the film,...

SandalwoodThe actor said that the dates for the film clashed with her other projects.Digital NativeDigital NativeLast month, director Dinesh Baboo announced his ambitious 50th film, Kasturi Mahal, with actor Rachita Ram in the lead. However, it now appears that she will not be a part of the project anymore. Confirming this, the actor cited date issues. She pointed out that she had date clashes with her other projects and therefore could not accommodate the film. Confirming Rachita’s exit, Dinesh Baboo said in an interview to Cinema Express, “We were all prepared to begin the shoot from October 5, and we just received the news about Rachita’s exit. I’m on the hunt for a replacement, and I hope to finalise a new female lead before we begin the shoot.” Rachita is one of the busiest heroines in the Kannada film industry, with a number of films in her kitty.

SandalwoodThe film will be directed by debutant Shoonya and produced by Ashu Bedra.Digital NativeDigital NativeKannada star Dhananjay has bagged the lead role in a biopic on the life of Bengaluru’s first underworld don, MP Jayaraj. The film will be directed by debutant Shoonya and produced by Ashu Bedra. Agni Shridhar, the scriptwriter of films like Aa Dinagalu, Edegarike and Kiragoorina Gayyaligalu and the director of Thamassu, is in charge of the script and dialogues of this biopic. It has been officially announced that this untitled film will start rolling in June this year and the prep work for it has begun already. Besides Dhananjay playing MP Jayaraj, the film will also have another lead actor to essay the role of politician Devaraj Urs. However, the filmmakers are yet to sign up for any actor for this role. Also, we hear that this biopic will be released in two parts in five languages – Kannada,...

SandalwoodThe film will be directed by debutant Shoonya and produced by Ashu Bedra.Digital NativeDigital NativeKannada star Dhananjay has bagged the lead role in a biopic on the life of Bengaluru’s first underworld don, MP Jayaraj. The film will be directed by debutant Shoonya and produced by Ashu Bedra. Agni Shridhar, the scriptwriter of films like Aa Dinagalu, Edegarike and Kiragoorina Gayyaligalu and the director of Thamassu, is in charge of the script and dialogues of this biopic. It has been officially announced that this untitled film will start rolling in June this year and the prep work for it has begun already. Besides Dhananjay playing MP Jayaraj, the film will also have another lead actor to essay the role of politician Devaraj Urs. However, the filmmakers are yet to sign up for any actor for this role. Also, we hear that this biopic will be released in two parts in five languages – Kannada,...

SandalwoodThe audio launch happened in Hubbali on Friday with Ramesh Aravind, Daali Dhananjay, Ashika Ranganath, Aditi Prabhudeva, and Deepika Das as guests of honor.Digital NativePrajwal Devaraj, who is overwhelmed with responses for his latest outing, Gentleman, is gearing up for his next, Inspector Vikram. The audio launch of the film happened in Hubbali on Friday. Gracing this event as guests of honor were Ramesh Aravind, Daali Dhananjay, Ashika Ranganath, Aditi Prabhudeva, and Deepika Das. Interestingly the event also celebrated as Prajwal’s 30th project. The film is directed by Narasimha and produced by Vikyath Vr under his banner. Prajwal Devaraj and Bhavana play the lead pair in Inspector Vikram which also has Raghu Mukherjee as the villain. The technical crew of the film comprises Anoop Seelin for music, Naveen Kumar for cinematography and Sathish and Sreenivas for art direction. Reports say that while Prajwal Devaraj will be seen in...

SandalwoodThe star had a muscle tear on his right shoulder and has been advised surgery.Digital NativeDigital NativeThe Kannada superstar Shiva Rajkumar will undergo a surgery in the UK on July 10, we hear. The star had a muscle tear on his right shoulder and has been advised surgery. Completing all his current assignments, Shiva Rajkumar has decided to take a break for the surgery and for recuperation. Shiva Rajkumar’s Rustum had hit the marquee on June 28 and is running to packed houses at the theatres. The film is produced by Jayanna and Bhogendra under the banner Jayanna Combines. Shraddha Srinath was roped in to play the female lead in it and Mayuri is appearing as Shiva Rajkumar’s sister. A romantic action entertainer, Rustum has Anoop Seelin scoring the music and Mahendra Simha wielding the camera. Shiva Rajkumar plays a cop in this flick and he sports a new look in it.

SandalwoodThe film reminds one of many other cop films but Shivanna fans are likely to be pleased by his "mass" role. Aravind ShwethaAfter a short sabbatical, superstar Dr Shivarajkumar is back in a "mass" role as a cop. The audience has always loved Shivanna more as an upright, merciless cop than a machete-wielding underworld don, especially after delivering hits like Killing Veerappan, Mufti and Tagaru. With Rustum, Shivanna has gone one step ahead to entertain the audience in multiple avatars. Always known for sporting clean-shaven looks, in Rustum, he gets a sharp moustache just like his father, the legendary thespian late Dr Rajkumar, and this reminds us a lot of the matinee idol in a few frames. There’s plenty of action, sentiment, a small layer of friendship, revenge and drama. Along the way, there’s plenty of machismo on display. The movie opens with the murder of an Ias officer.

SandalwoodThe actor will be the first among Sandalwood stars to enter the digital media platform.Digital NativeKannada superstar Shiva Rajkumar will be the first among Sandalwood stars to enter the digital media platform. The star himself made the announcement recently in a media interaction. He has been quoted by Cinema Express as saying, “Our production house, Sree Muthu Cine Services, which is handled by my daughter Niveditha, is already into making web series, and has completed the shoot for Hate You Romeo and Honey Moon. This Ott platform is a new experience, and I thought it’s time for me to try something in the digital arena.” He further said, “We plan to go with the title Omkara, as it is the beginning of all new things. An official announcement will be made at the right time.” Meanwhile, the star’s Rustum is gearing up for release on June 28. Directed by stunt master Ravi Varma,...

SandalwoodReports say that the postponement is due to delay in the computer graphics work.Digital NativeKannada superstar Shiva Rajkumar’s Rustum was supposed to hit the marquee on June 14 and was heading for a box office clash with Upendra’s I Love You. However, this clash has been averted as Rustum’s release has been postponed to June 28. Reports say that the postponement is due to delay in the computer graphics work. Rustum is produced by Jayanna and Bhogendra under the banner Jayanna Combines. Shraddha Srinath has been roped in to play the female lead while Mayuri will be seen as Shiva Rajkumar’s sister. A romantic action entertainer, Rustum will have Anoop Seelin scoring the music and Mahendra Simha wielding the camera. According to reports, Shiva Rajkumar plays a cop in this flick and will be sporting a new look. Fans can expect to see some daredevilry stunts in the film.

SandalwoodHowever, their roles are being kept a secret for now. Digital NativeDirector P Vasu and Kannada superstar Shiva Rajkumar are collaborating for the second time, creating a lot of expectations among their fans. While their first outing Shivalinga was a big hit, this time they are associating for a film with the working title Anand. According to reports doing rounds, veteran actors Prabhu and Suhasini Mani Ratnam have been roped in to play important roles in this flick. However, their roles are being kept a secret for now. A major portion of the shooting has been completed and reports are that a 16-day final schedule is being planned. The climax portions of Anand and one song will be canned in Mangaluru while a fight sequence in Madikeri. There are also plans to film a train scene in Hyderabad. Rachita Ram is playing Shiva Rajkumar’s heroine in this film and...

SandalwoodBoth films will be out in theatres on June 14, confirm sources.Digital NativeDigital NativeThere is an interesting box office clash set to happen in Sandalwood next month. Yes, according to reports, Shiva Rajkumar’s Rustum and Upendra’s I Love You have locked in on the same release date. Both these films will be out in theatres on June 14, confirm sources. Trade sources point out that the makers of Rustum are planning a big release and the film is likely to be released in 500 screens across India. And I Love You, being a Kannada-Telugu bilingual, is expected to get 600 screens in Karnataka and 400 screens in Telugu speaking regions. Rustum is helmed by the stunt director turned director Ravi Varma and produced by Jayanna and Bhogendra under the banner Jayanna Combines. Shraddha Srinath has been roped in to play the lead opposite Shiva Rajkumar and Mayuri will be seen as Shiva Rajkumar’s sister.

SandalwoodWhile there is speculation that this is a sequel to ‘Bhajarangi’, it has been clarified that this is a completely different film and only the title is being used.Digital NativeDigital NativeKannada star Shiva Rajkumar and director A Harsha had teamed up for the first time in 2013 for Bhajarangi, which turned out to be a blockbuster hit. Later on they worked together in Vajrakaya in 2015. Recently, there was an announcement that the duo would be collaborating for a film titled My Name is Anji. However, it has now been revealed that this film has been re-titled as Bhajarangi 2. While there is speculation that it may be a sequel to their hit movie Bhajarangi, it has been clarified that Bhajarangi 2 will be a completely different film and only the title is being used. Touted to be a commercial entertainer, Bhajarangi 2 will be bankrolled by Jayanna and Bogendra under the banner Jayanna Films.

SandalwoodThe filmmaker revealed that the star will play the role of a legal adviser to those indulging in illegal activities.Digital NativeThe scripting for a Kannada film with the super star Shiva Rajkumar in mind will begin soon, say sources. Filmmakers Raghuram Dp and Raja Durai will be penning the script jointly and the work will begin from April 27, confirm sources in the know. Speaking about the project, Raghuram said in an interview to Cinema Express, “With Shivanna on board, it will be a complete mass entertainer. The actor will play the role of a legal adviser to those indulging in illegal activities. I have this plot ready as of now. It will be worked on these lines. Once I am satisfied with the script, I will take it forward with Shivanna.” The filmmaker further said that he would take the script to Shiva Rajkumar once the scripting was complete...

SandalwoodThe film stars Shraddha Srinath opposite Shiva Rajkumar, who will be seen playing a cop.Digital NativeThe trailer of the Shiva Rajkumar starrer Rustum was released recently and is going viral among film buffs. The hero is seen mouthing the punch dialogue: “Mujhe arrest bole tho allergy... Encounter bole tho energy,” in the trailer, which has fans going crazy over it. Talking about the film, Rustum director Ravi Varma told Cinema Express in an interview: “Rustum will have Shivanna featuring in three action sequences out of five. The fourth will feature Vivek Oberoi, and the last one will be a chase.” The director added that he is planning to release Rustum towards the end of May. In this regard, he said, “The film is now in re-recording stages. We are looking for a May release. An official announcement will be made on this front once we present the film to the censor board.

SandalwoodTouted to be a commercial entertainer, the film will be directed by A Harsha.Digital NativeDigital NativeShiva Rajkumar’s next film in the pipeline is My Name is Anji. The film will be directed by A Harsha and the groundwork for it is currently on. According to reports, the shooting of My Name is Anji will begin in June this year. Incidentally, Harsha and Shiva Rajkumar have worked together in Bhajarangi and Vajrakaya in the past and this is their third venture together. About the female lead to star opposite Shiva Rajkumar in My Name is Anji, we hear that it will be Bhavana. The filmmakers feel that she would be the right choice to play the role as she shares a good rapport with the hero having worked with him in the past. Touted to be a commercial entertainer, My Name is Anji will be bankrolled by Jayanna and...

SandalwoodThe duo has earlier given two hit films – ‘Bhajarangi’ and ‘Vajrakaya’.Digital NativeSandalwood superstar Shiva Rajkumar and director Harsha have given two hit films – Bhajarangi and Vajrakaya – so far and are now set to team up again. This time it will be for My Name is Anji. With their third time collaboration, fans are hoping for a hat trick from this duo. Touted to be a commercial entertainer, My Name is Anji will be bankrolled by Jayanna and Bogendra under the banner Jayanna Films. Reports indicate that the groundwork for this film is on and that the shooting will begin in June this year. Meanwhile, Shiva Rajkumar’s next film release will be Kavacha. The film is in the post-production stage and its release date is expected to be announced officially soon. Directed by Gvr Vasu, the movie is bankrolled by Mvv Sathyanarayanan under the banner Hayagriva Movie Adishtana. A...

SandalwoodShiva Rajkumar and Harsha share a good rapport after having worked together earlier in ‘Bhajarangi’ and ‘Vaayuputra’.Digital NativeChoreographer-turned-director A Harsha and Yash had announced long back that they will be working together for a film titled Raana. However, there have been no updates about it. Sources in the know say that after the grand success of Kgf Chapter 1, Yash is looking for an even bigger hit and so is keen on releasing its sequel. Therefore, he has decided not to work on Harsha’s film, the sources say. Another set of rumours doing the rounds is that Yash had wanted Harsha to make some changes to the script, but the latter did not agree. Whatever the reason, it is now almost certain that Yash will not be working with Harsha on Raana. Meanwhile, we hear that Kannada superstar Shiva Rajkumar may be hopping onboard Raana. Sources in the know...

SandalwoodTo be directed by AP Arjun, the shooting for this entertainer will reportedly begin in July this year.Digital NativeDigital NativeKannada star Shiva Rajkumar’s next film release will be Kavacha. The film is in the post-production stage and its release date is expected to be officially announced soon. Kavacha, which is directed by Gvr Vasu, is bankrolled by Mvv Sathyanarayanan under the banner Hayagriva Movie Adishtana. Kruthika Jayakumar plays the lead opposite Shiva Rajkumar. The star cast also includes Isha Koppikar, Baby Meenakshi and Vasishta N Simha in pivotal roles. Rahul Shrivastav is cranking the camera for the film and the music is composed by Arjun Janya. A remake of the Malayalam blockbuster Oppam, Shiva Rajkumar will appear as a blind man in this movie. It was supposed to release late last year, then January 18 was said to be the release date but now it looks like the release has been postponed yet again.

SandalwoodThe film will be directed by Raghu Haasan.Tnm StaffDirector Prem’s The Villain hit the marquee and has completed 50 days at the box office successfully. Being a multi starrer, it has Shiva Rajkumar and Kiccha Sudeep in the lead roles. The Villain’s collections at the box office were good but there were some controversies over it. Shiva Rajkumar’s fans were not happy over the way his role in the film was shaped and eventually, the director, unable to bear the trolls, filed a police complaint. Then came a tweet from Sudeep making sarcastic remarks about the film not being promoted post its release. Putting an end to all these controversies, Prem has begun to concentrate on his next project. He will not be wielding the megaphone for the film Gandhigiri but will be playing the main lead. This film was announced last year but it is taking...

SandalwoodThe actor is reportedly going to make his debut in Mollywood too with the Mohanlal starrer 'Lucifer', marking the directorial of Prithviraj.Digital NativeBollywood actor Vivek Oberoi is reportedly going to star in the Kannada film Rustum that will have Shiva Rajkumar in the lead role. A romantic action entertainer, Rustum will mark the directorial debut of ace stunt master Ravi Varma. The film is produced under the banner Jayanna Combines. Shraddha Srinath has been roped in to play the female lead and Mayuri will be seen as Shiva Rajkumar’s sister in Rustum. Anoop Seelin is scoring the music for this movie and Mahendra Simha is wielding the camera. According to reports, Shiva Rajkumar plays a cop in this flick and he will be sporting a new look in it. Vivek Oberoi was seen last year in Tamil playing the villain in the Ajith starrer Vivegam. It may be mentioned here that there are reports that he will be sharing screen space with Mohanlal in his upcoming Malayalam film Lucifer. The film will be marking the debut of actor Prithviraj as a director. The shooting of Lucifer, which will also have Manju Warrier, Sania Iyapan, and Indrajith Sukumaran in significant roles, is reportedly scheduled to begin soon. Vivek Oberoi made his acting debut in Bollywood with the Ram Gopal Varma directorial Company in 2002, which too, incidentally had Mohanlal play a significant role as a police officer. Vivek went on to win the Filmfare Best Debut Award and Filmfare Best Supporting Actor Award for the character. He made his debut in Tamil and Telugu film industries with Rakta Charitram and Rakta Charitra respectively. (Content provided by Digital Native) Also read: 'Koode' review: Anjali Menon proves that she's the master of depicting relationships...
